metadata.description: Name of the Function App (must be globally unique)
Storage Account Name (3-24 characters, lowercase and numbers only)
Name for the Azure OpenAI Service
Azure OpenAI Model to deploy. All models use the tools API format.
Deployment capacity in thousands of tokens per minute (TPM). Start with 10 and increase if needed based on your quota.
REQUIRED: Select region for Azure OpenAI Service. Choose a region with available quota (different from your resource group region if needed).
Python version to use (3.11 required for Azure Functions v4 compatibility)

IMPORTANT: Must be 'Allow' for Flex Consumption Function Apps. The deployment pipeline (Kudu) requires public network access to upload function packages. Security is maintained via Azure AD auth (allowSharedKeyAccess=false) and RBAC roles. Do NOT change this to 'Deny' or deployment will fail with 403 errors.

resources.comments: CRITICAL: Storage account MUST have publicNetworkAccess=Enabled for Flex Consumption deployments. The Kudu deployment pipeline requires network access to upload function packages to blob storage.
resources.name: [parameters('storageAccountName')]

resources.comments: CRITICAL: Storage Account Contributor - Required for Flex Consumption Function Apps to fully access storage

resources.comments: Storage Blob Data Owner - Full control over blob data (required for deployment container access)
resources.name: [guid(parameters('storageAccountName'), parameters('functionAppName'), variables('storageBlobDataOwnerRoleId'))]

resources.comments: Storage Blob Data Contributor - Required for deployment pipeline to upload/download function packages
resources.name: [guid(parameters('storageAccountName'), parameters('functionAppName'), variables('storageBlobDataContributorRoleId'))]

resources.comments: Storage File Data Privileged Contributor - Required for Azure Files token-based authentication with token_intent=backup
resources.name: [guid(parameters('storageAccountName'), parameters('functionAppName'), variables('storageFileDataPrivilegedContributorRoleId'))]

resources.comments: Storage Queue Data Contributor - Required for Azure Functions trigger bindings
resources.name: [guid(parameters('storageAccountName'), parameters('functionAppName'), variables('storageQueueDataContributorRoleId'))]

resources.comments: Storage Table Data Contributor - Required for Azure Functions durable functions and state management
resources.name: [guid(parameters('storageAccountName'), parameters('functionAppName'), variables('storageTableDataContributorRoleId'))]

Or use Azure CLI:

macLinuxSetupScript.value:
[concat('#!/bin/bash
# CommunityRAPP - Mac/Linux Setup Script
# Generated from ARM deployment
# Uses Azure AD (Entra ID) authentication - no API keys required

set -e
RED="\033[0;31m" GREEN="\033[0;32m" YELLOW="\033[1;33m" BLUE="\033[0;34m" NC="\033[0m"

echo -e "${BLUE}========================================${NC}"
echo -e "${BLUE}CommunityRAPP - Local Setup${NC}"
echo -e "${BLUE}========================================${NC}"

FUNCTION_APP_NAME="', parameters('functionAppName'), '"
RESOURCE_GROUP="', resourceGroup().name, '"
SUBSCRIPTION_ID="', subscription().subscriptionId, '"
OPENAI_SERVICE_NAME="', parameters('openAIServiceName'), '"
OPENAI_ENDPOINT="', reference(variables('openAIResourceId')).endpoint, '"
OPENAI_DEPLOYMENT="', parameters('openAIDeploymentName'), '"
STORAGE_ACCOUNT="', parameters('storageAccountName'), '"
FILE_SHARE="', variables('fileShareName'), '"
ASSISTANT_NAME="', parameters('assistantName'), '"
CHARACTERISTIC_DESC="', parameters('characteristicDescription'), '"
FUNCTION_URL="https://', reference(variables('functionAppId')).defaultHostName, '/api/businessinsightbot_function"
REPO_URL="https://github.com/kody-w/CommunityRAPP.git"

if [[ "$OSTYPE" == "darwin"* ]]; then OS_TYPE="macos"; else OS_TYPE="linux"; fi

find_python311() {
    for cmd in python3.11 python311; do
        if command -v $cmd &>/dev/null; then
            ver=$($cmd --version 2>&1)
            [[ $ver == *"3.11"* ]] && echo $cmd && return 0
        fi
    done
    if [[ "$OS_TYPE" == "macos" ]]; then
        for p in /opt/homebrew/bin/python3.11 /usr/local/bin/python3.11; do
            [[ -x $p ]] && echo $p && return 0
        done
    fi
    return 1
}

echo -e "${YELLOW}Checking prerequisites...${NC}"

command -v git &>/dev/null || { if [[ "$OS_TYPE" == "macos" ]]; then brew install git; else sudo apt-get update && sudo apt-get install -y git; fi; }
echo -e "${GREEN}[OK] Git${NC}"

PYTHON_CMD=$(find_python311) || {
    echo -e "${YELLOW}Installing Python 3.11...${NC}"
    if [[ "$OS_TYPE" == "macos" ]]; then brew install python@3.11; else sudo apt-get update && sudo apt-get install -y python3.11 python3.11-venv; fi
    PYTHON_CMD=$(find_python311) || { echo -e "${RED}Failed to install Python 3.11${NC}"; exit 1; }
}
echo -e "${GREEN}[OK] Python 3.11: $PYTHON_CMD${NC}"

command -v func &>/dev/null || { if [[ "$OS_TYPE" == "macos" ]]; then brew tap azure/functions && brew install azure-functions-core-tools@4; else npm install -g azure-functions-core-tools@4; fi; }
echo -e "${GREEN}[OK] Azure Functions Core Tools${NC}"

command -v az &>/dev/null || { if [[ "$OS_TYPE" == "macos" ]]; then brew install azure-cli; else curl -sL https://aka.ms/InstallAzureCLIDeb | sudo bash; fi; }
echo -e "${GREEN}[OK] Azure CLI${NC}"

az account show &>/dev/null || az login
USER_OBJECT_ID=$(az ad signed-in-user show --query id -o tsv)
echo -e "${GREEN}[OK] Logged in${NC}"

echo -e "${YELLOW}Assigning roles...${NC}"
az role assignment create --assignee "$USER_OBJECT_ID" --role "Storage File Data Privileged Contributor" --scope "/subscriptions/$SUBSCRIPTION_ID/resourceGroups/$RESOURCE_GROUP/providers/Microsoft.Storage/storageAccounts/$STORAGE_ACCOUNT" 2>/dev/null || true
az role assignment create --assignee "$USER_OBJECT_ID" --role "Cognitive Services OpenAI User" --scope "/subscriptions/$SUBSCRIPTION_ID/resourceGroups/$RESOURCE_GROUP/providers/Microsoft.CognitiveServices/accounts/$OPENAI_SERVICE_NAME" 2>/dev/null || true
echo -e "${GREEN}[OK] Roles assigned${NC}"

if [ -d "CommunityRAPP" ]; then cd CommunityRAPP && git pull; else git clone $REPO_URL && cd CommunityRAPP; fi

[ -d ".venv" ] && rm -rf .venv
$PYTHON_CMD -m venv .venv
source .venv/bin/activate
pip install --upgrade pip -q && pip install -r requirements.txt -q

cat > local.settings.json << SETTINGS
{
  "IsEncrypted": false,
  "Values": {
    "FUNCTIONS_WORKER_RUNTIME": "python",
    "AzureWebJobsStorage__accountName": "$STORAGE_ACCOUNT",
    "AZURE_OPENAI_ENDPOINT": "$OPENAI_ENDPOINT",
    "AZURE_OPENAI_API_VERSION": "2025-01-01-preview",
    "AZURE_OPENAI_DEPLOYMENT_NAME": "$OPENAI_DEPLOYMENT",
    "AZURE_STORAGE_ACCOUNT_NAME": "$STORAGE_ACCOUNT",
    "AZURE_FILES_SHARE_NAME": "$FILE_SHARE",
    "ASSISTANT_NAME": "$ASSISTANT_NAME",
    "CHARACTERISTIC_DESCRIPTION": "$CHARACTERISTIC_DESC"
  }
}
SETTINGS

func azure functionapp publish $FUNCTION_APP_NAME --build remote

echo -e "${GREEN}========================================${NC}"
echo -e "${GREEN}Setup Complete!${NC}"
echo -e "${GREEN}========================================${NC}"
echo "Function URL: $FUNCTION_URL"
echo "To run locally: ./run.sh"
')]
